rdf:Description.rdf:about: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Breakdown of how samples were processed and size fractionated

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the area of the benthos that was sampled for a given sample.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#The sample area
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Study site name
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Name of the study site

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the RCC study site
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the name of the study site.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the unique identifier for each sample.

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#These are the sample identifications that were recorded off of the lab datasheets. Note that some sites and year do not exhibit consecutive sampling numbers. When a detrital depletion sample was taken, the first number in the column is the dome sample number. The second number is the detrital sample number. The samples with the 'a' designation are the samples used for invertebrate calculations. The samples with the 'b' or 'c' designation are the detrital depletion samples that were not used in the invertebrate calculations.

ns1:hasAttributeName.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop## in Size Fraction ≥1mm or ≥500um (# per sample)
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop## in Size Fraction ≤1mm and ≥100µm (# per sample)

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This provides a nearby reference point for each study reach.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Geographic reference point for each study site.
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Latitude of Study Site

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#These are the latitude measurements for the study site.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This the sample type of the specific sample

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Two types of samples were identified. Invert samples are the ones that were used for the invertebrate assemblage calculations. The detrital depletion are replicate samples at the dome sampling sites, which were not used in the invertebrate calculations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The data presented here represent the benthic macroinvertebrate data collected in 1976 and 1977 along the Salmon River mainstem. These data were part of the original river continuum concept (RCC) project. Seven sites were sampled seasonally over the two year period. Four sites on the upper Salmon River mainstem (i.e., Camp, Smiley, Obsidian, and Casino) were sampled in March and July of 1976. Four sites on the mid to lower Salmon River were sampled in March/April, July, and September/October of 1977 (i.e., Casino, Deadman's hole, Shoup, and Slate). However, only Shoup and Slate were processed during the July 1977 sampling trip. Additional samples (i.e., transport and benthic organic matter) were sampled during other trips, but the data presented here are the only seasonal samples that were processed for invertebrates. Samples were collected either via a 'dustpan-kicknet' (1976) or a dome sampler (1977). Invertebrates were identified and counted. As the methods differ between years, interannual differences can only be compared based on relative abundance. These data are the basis for the following manuscripts. Minshall, G. W., J. T. Brock, and T. W. Lapoint. 1982. Characterization and dynamics of benthic organic-matter and invertebrate functional feeding group relationships in the upper Salmon River, Idaho (USA). Internationale Revue der Gesamten Hydrobiologie 67:793-820. Minshall, G. W., R. C. Petersen, T. L. Bott, C. E. Cushing, K. W. Cummins, R. L. Vannote, and J. R. Sedell. 1992. Stream ecosystem dynamics of the Salmon River, Idaho: An 8th order system. Journal of the North American Benthological Society 11:111-137. Minshall, G. W., R. C. Petersen, K. W. Cummins, T. L. Bott, J. R. Sedell, C. E. Cushing, and R. L. Vannote. 1983. Interbiome comparison of stream ecosystem dynamics. Ecological Monographs 53:1-25.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Salmon River RCC Benthic Invertebrate Data

rdf:Description.rdf:about: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop## in Size Fraction ≥1mm or ≥500um (# per sample)

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Abundance of individuals in the large size fraction

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the number of individuals per sample. In 1976, this was defined as individuals ≥ 1mm. In 1977, this was defined as individuals ≥ 500micrometers.

ns1:hasEntityDescription.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#These are the benthic invertebrate samples that were collected during the original river continuum concept (RCC) project. Samples were collected at 7 locations along the Salmon River mainstem.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Notes about the old taxonomic name for a particular organism

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Between the 1970s and the present, taxonomic names have changed. The name reported here is the name originally reported in the RCC publications, which has been updated in the genus column.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Study Site Location Names

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#These are the actual study site locations.
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the particular month that a sample was collected.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the month that a sample was collected.
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Habitat type where the sample was taken.

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the habitat type where a specific sample was taken.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#The date a sample was taken

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the date that sample was collected

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the date that a sample was collected.

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the specific date that a sample was collected.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Notes on the substrate and habitat of a particular sample

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This reports the dominant substrate or habitat that was present at a given sampling location. Also, this indicates which invert sample that a detrital depletion sample was coupled with.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Taxonomic genus

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the genus that an individual was classified as
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the specific year that a sample was collected.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the year that the sample was collected.

ns1:hasEntityDescription.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is a table that summarizes how and which samples were size fractionated each year

ns1:hasEntity.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Breakdown of how samples were processed and size fractionated

rdf:Description.rdf:about: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop## in Size Fraction ≤1mm and ≥100µm (# per sample)

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop## in the smaller size fraction

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the total number of individuals of a particular taxonomic group that was found in the smaller size fraction of that sample. In 1977, this was defined as ≤500micrometer and ≥100micrometer. This size fraction was not collected during 1976.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the day of the month that a sample was collected.

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the day of the month that a particular sample was collected.
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the development stage that an individual was classified as. adult, nymph, larvae, or pupae

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Development stage

ns1:hasEntityDescription.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#These are the GPS coordinates of the RCC study sites

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Notes on how and which samples were size fractionated

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This describes the sampling method used. It also indicates which samples were size fractionated and picked.
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the taxonomic order that a particular individual belonged to

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Taxonomic order

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the type of instrument used to collect the sample. In 1976, a modified kicknet was used. In 1977, a dome sampler was used.

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the type of sample instrument used
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Taxomic species designation

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the species name of the particular organism
http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#This is the taxonomic family that an individual was classified as

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Taxonomic family

ns1:hasAttributeDefinition.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Longitude of the study site

ns1:hasAttributeLabel.rdf:resource: http://example.namespace/ex1/prop#Longitude of the study site
